article: The passengers watched sympathetically as the woman made her way carefully up the steps. She paid the bus driver and _ the seat which the driver had told her was empty. Then she settled in   It had been a year since Susan, 34, became blind. Due to a medical misdiagnosis ,she was _ thrown into a world of darkness, frustration and self-pity. And all she had to stick to was her husband, Mark.  Mark was an air force officer and he loved Susan with all his heart. He was _ to help his wife gain the strength and _ . For the first two weeks, Mark _ Susan to and from work each day. He taught her how to rely on her other _ , specifically her hearing, to determine where she was and how to adapt to  the _ environment. _ , Susan decided that she was ready to try the trip on her own. Monday morning, she said good-bye, and for the first time, they went _ ways.  On Friday morning, Susan took the bus to work as usual . As she was getting off the bus, the driver said, "Girl, I _ envy you." Susan had no idea _ the driver was talking about, and asked, "What do you mean?"  The driver answered, "You know, every morning for the past _ , a fine looking gentleman in a military uniform has been standing across the corner, _ you get off the bus and cross the street safely. He watches until you enter your office building. You are one _ lady."  Tears of _ poured down Susan's cheeks. Mark had given her a gift more _ than sight, a gift that can bring _ where there is darkness.
